definition: Han Fei, also known as Han Feizi 韓非子|韩非子[Han2 Fei1 zi3] (c. 280-233 BC), Legalist philosopher of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897/Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国/surname Han
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
Han Feizi, book of Legalist Philosophy authored by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)

sentences.english: Hanfeizi has reflected Hanfei's political viewpoint in a concentrated way.
sentences.chinese: 《韓非子》集中反映了韓非的政治觀點。

sentences.english: Hanfeizi has reflected Hanfei's political viewpoint in a concentrated way.
sentences.chinese: 《韓非子》集中反映了韓非的政治觀點。

sentences.english: Recognizing Han Fei, in particular its law philosophy is a responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 認識韓非，尤其是其法哲學思想是一種責任。

sentences.english: Hanfeizi is one of the most important writings in warring states period.
sentences.chinese: 《韓非子》是我國戰國末期的一部重要文獻。

sentences.english: Han Fei inherited and developed the perspectives of reason and desire of Huan-Law Teachings.
sentences.chinese: 韓非繼承和發展了黃老之學的理欲觀。

sentences.english: Today my aunt took me to Happy Land.
sentences.chinese: 今天我的姑姑帶我去韓非樂園。

sentences.english: Legalist Han Fei theory and from different angles.
sentences.chinese: 法家韓非從不同角度論和。

sentences.english: But I'm sure that Han Fei the design is presented.
sentences.chinese: 但可以肯定的是韓非的設計思想比較堅決。

sentences.english: Han Fei is the great master of legal thinking at the end of the Warring States period.
sentences.chinese: 韓非是戰國末季法家思想的集大成者。

sentences.english: Legalism Han Fei is a master of the late Warring States Period were.
sentences.chinese: 韓非是戰國末年法家思想的集大成者。

sentences.english: The second chapter "Han Feizi" cites the historical facts reflection the thought.
sentences.chinese: 第二章是《韓非子》稱引故實反映的思想。

sentences.english: Han Fei-tzu sat in lotus position on the bare wooden floor beside his wife's sickbed.
sentences.chinese: 韓非子坐在她妻子的病牀旁，光木地板上的蓮座裏。

sentences.english: The Comparison of Mind Theory from Shyun Tze and Han Fei …
sentences.chinese: 荀子論心和韓非子所蘊涵的心論之比較研究。

sentences.english: In Part One, Han Fei advocated that the principles of benefits be drive of ruling the country.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分，韓非提出用利益原則來作爲治國的驅動力。

sentences.english: Han Fei and the rule of law is based on the reality that exists.
sentences.chinese: 韓非的法治主義的基礎是對現實存在的相信。

sentences.english: Rebelliously, Han Fei-tzu gave her the most false answer to her question.
sentences.chinese: 韓非子難以控制的給了她最錯誤的答案。

definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
On learning, classic book by Confucian philosopher Xun Zi 荀子 (c. 310-237 BC)
